bibl.title: C. W. Hutchinson v. Territory of Washington. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of Washington Terrtorry of the 3rd Judicial District holding terms at Seattle
In the matter of the application of C.W. Hutchinson for relief in Habeas Corpus Writ} Petition
To the stan P.J. Greene . Judge of the above court
C.W.Hutchinson petitioner herein makes complaint to your Honor and says:

That he is restrained of his liberty by one Leuis HonWH Harris Doren a constable of the Seatle Sacema Precinct in King County to T. and is so restrained by him the said constable HarrisHarrisonat and in the city of Seattle & confined in the persoude custody of said constable

II That the pretended cause or pretenses of such illegal restraints is a charge or pretended complaint against your petitioner
charging or purpurting to dis charde this petitioner with the charge of fraudulenly and feloniously embezzing & converting to his own use a certain sum of money to wit & IHQ in money from one WSHarris, said complaint having been made by one WKHarris; the custody of this petitioner is by virtue of a pretended warrant, reporting to issue from one Alex Campbell who reports to be a justeen of the Peace said pretended warrant. being in the house of the said Leuis WSHarris constable as a forsaid, said Warrant pursporting to be from Pierce County in this Territoru

III That the said restraint is illegal, that the saud illegality of such restraint consists in the unlawful detention of your petitioner by & through what a certain piece of paper purponting to be a warrant, which paper is af no cansequenses, is well
void & to no ofect, that the Awether illegallity of such cam detention is that cheres no offense knows to the laios of Washington Territory named in such petition warrants

Therefore petitioner prays that your Honor issue to him a writ of Habeas Corpus directed to the said Lewis VanPonderWCSHArris commanding him to be and appear before your honor at same time certain fixed and definite immediately or as soon as your honor will see fit and to then and have the body of your petitioner that your Honor may then there enggaune of and determine why your Petitioner is so illegalley restrained of his liberty
And Youve Petitioner Will everpray etc
C.W.Hutchinson
by his attorneys at Law Pasing jilman and Jas H. Lewis
Territory of Washington County of King} SS
C.W.Hutchinson being duly sworn on oath says that he is the petitioner named in the forgaing petition and has read the said petition and knows its contents & believes the same true
C.H. Hutchinson
Sworn to & subscribed before me this 12th day of November at 1885
S.C Gilman Notary Public
Territpry of Washington County of } SS.

First duly swon, on oath says: That he is the in the above entitled action:Tht he has heard the foregoing read, knows the contents therof, belives the same to be true: that he makes this affidavit because
Subscribed will sworn to before me this day of 188 Notarary Public in and for King County, Washington Territory

I. JAMES SEAVEY, clerk of the District Court, holding terms at Seattle, in King County, Washington Territory, hereby certify that the foregoing is a true copy of the in the foregoing entitled cause now on file in my office
Witness y hand and seal of said Court this day of 188
By Deputy Receive at in County, Washington Territory, this day of 188, a true copy of the foregoing. Attorney for
NOV 18, 1885 FILE NOV 18 1885
In the District Court, Third Judicial District, holding Terms at Seattle
In re application at plaintif VS. C.H. Hutchinson and for Habeas Corpus Defendant
Petitoiner of Hutchinson
Filed 188 Clerk By deputy
FILED NOV 12 1885 James Seavey, Clerk By James P. Ludlow Deputy Clerk,

DUKE & RASIN and and James
Attorney for Petitioner
